sentence.Network_en: His criticisms of the president stirred up a hornet's nest.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对董事长的批评造成众愤难平.

sentence.Network_en: A hornet stung me on the cheek.
sentence.Network_cn: 一只大黄蜂叮了我的脸颊.

sentence.Network_en: His letter to the newspaper about racialism in schools has stirred up a real hornet's nest.
sentence.Network_cn: 他给报纸写的关于学校中存在种族歧视现象的信件引起了很大的麻烦.

jx.jx_en_mean: a situation fraught with difficulties or complications

lj.lj_ly: the move has &B{stirred up a hornet's nest} of academic fear and loathing.
lj.lj_ls: 这次行动引起了学术恐慌和厌恶，惹了一堆麻烦。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hyrnet, of Germanic origin; related to German Hornisse. The form of the word was probably influenced by Middle Dutch and Middle Low German hornte

entry.def: A hornet is a large wasp. Hornets live in nests and have a powerful sting.

entry.tran: 一大堆麻烦;棘手的局面;马蜂窝
entry.def: If you say that someone has stirred up a hornet's nest, you mean that they have done something which has caused a lot of argument or trouble.

auth_sentence.content: This simulated invasion caused the bees to swarm around the hornet.

sentences.en: Laws catch flies,but let hornets go free.
sentences.cn: 法律如蛛网,捉得住苍蝇,捉不住黄蜂。

sentences.en: His criticisms of the president stirred up a hornet’s nest.
sentences.cn: 他对董事长的批评造成众愤难平。

sentences.en: When Charles got the manager’s job, it stirred up a real hornet’s nest, because everyone was angry about his fast promotion.
sentences.cn: 查尔斯当上经理简直像捅了马蜂窝，大家对他升职这么快感到很不满。
